page.title: 10Kiwi School Bulford
page.content: Kiwi School is one of the two Primary Schools on the Camp.It has 214 pupils between the ages 5 and 11 and eight teaching staff.The longest serving teacher is the Deputy Headmistress who has been in the school since it opened 20 years ago. The majority of the children in the school,(there is only one exception) are the children of serving army personnel. As a result of their father'S postings they stay in the school for only 18 months to 2 years. The school is named after the Kiwi cut out of the chalk hill above Bulford,and because of this New Zealand connection the school has been visited by the All Black's rugby team and the New Zealand High Commissioner.
